attributes.title: Pray From Powerful Space Of Oneness - SOHAM'ASMI
attributes.description:
In today's Nithya Satsang (16th October, 2015), live from Varanasi, on the fourth day of Navratri, Paramahamsa Nithyananda decodes the inner space of Rishis from Isa Upanishad, verse 16th, which declares the truth of the powerful prayerful space of oneness. The beauty of Santana Hindu Dharma is that teaches us prayer, and allows no place for powerlessness and praying as beggars to divine. It is wrong assumption to think that we are weak and God is powerful. He reveals, 'Even when you pray, you are not separate from the source; remembering that “I am He - SOHAMASMI. However low you may feel with your self, inner image; however great you may feel your God is, you need to remember the absolute reality: both are from the same Source. Never be a beggar in front of God, because anything makes you feel beggar is not worthy; real God makes you powerful."

pūṣann ekarṣe yama sūrya prājāpatya vyūha raśmīn samūha tejaḥ | yat te rūpaṁ kalyāṇatamaṁ tat te paśyāmi yo sāv asau puruṣaḥ, so’ham asmi ||16||
